answers.answer: Very neat!  I just hope they don't decide to let bee's swarm around airplanes and things...I am allergic (the kind of allergy that can kill you), so that would cut down my flying to....none.lol.  Can you imagine...flights entering the US with all the bees on board flying around looking for the terrorists?  Kind of a funny thought..hehe.

question: http://www.bing.com/videos/watch/video/are-bees-the-new-tool-in-fighting-terrorism/6xglhou?q=Bees&rel=msn&from=en-us_msnhp&form=msnhed&gt1=43001Nov. 6: Reese Halter with Cal Lutheran University talks about using bees to fight terrorism because of their heightened scent detection, ability to learn the process quickly and their 98% accuracy in detection, opposed to sniffing dogs who are 71% accurate.Follow link above to view videoIt takes 10 minutes to train them! They say it is foolproof. Very cost efficient... They can also be used to detect pregnance, medical conditions like cancer and diabetes.
title: Are bees the new tool in fighting terrorism?
